name: Islamic Society of Greater Houston
mission: Helping the community to live sustainable lives.
zakatClaimEvidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Society of Greater Houston earns 40/100 due to good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: As part of its zakat services, the ISGH has special food stamps which can be used to pay bills and rent, bus fare, and items from Muslim grocery stores. They have a system in place to receive their zaka. money and an online system to pay it. In 2024, ISGH was among the largest providers of financial assistance in our community with over $4.9M in Zakat and Sadaqah distributions. The ISGH website also lists 'ISGH Zakat Ul Maal' under 'Online Giving' and provides an 'ISGH Assistance Application' with an email address 'zakat@isgh.org' for submitting zakat requests. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGLB5ffemMFN7ZaGRUjlLW6W1yEfMuBTmXW83DPQsp1hQ-J_gttvRvmWpfnHlXbc-W2BP1AG-9NV43fu1ZnN52nwXw_nKnoF_JPgrI8awMKZtkE_BYV4ZvHTR_ujnGLF4Zrrf6DcZMo2T1AExcswvaV8aRyJLgtth_laDk=)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides Zakat distribution, weekend schools, and funeral services.
The charity offers various donation options and is zakat-eligible.
The organization's profile metadata and financial fields are tracked but lack a comprehensive rating.
Financial data and organizational structure are documented in public tax filings.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization holds a moderate overall score of 40/100, reflecting its significant community presence and religious alignment, though it is currently limited by low data confidence and a lack of verified financial efficiency metrics.
areas_for_improvement: Limited transparency regarding detailed financial efficiency metrics and third-party ratings
Low data confidence score suggests a need for more robust public financial reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 30/50, the charity shows medium donor fit due to its religious and cultural urgency within the Greater Houston area [1]. It maintains a steady track record of service delivery, though further transparency is needed to reach high alignment levels [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact is characterized as capacity building, focusing on long-term community infrastructure such as cemetery development and educational enrollment [1][3]. However, the impact score of 15/50 reflects a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and limited third-party verification of program effectiveness [3][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston serves as a central pillar for the Muslim community in Texas, providing essential religious, educational, and social welfare services.
strengths: Established provider of essential religious services including funeral and cemetery management
Strong community engagement with high weekend school enrollment and Quran distribution
Zakat-eligible status providing a verified channel for Islamic charitable obligations
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston (ISGH) is dedicated to helping the community live sustainable lives through comprehensive social programs and religious infrastructure [1]. As a zakat-eligible organization, it facilitates the distribution of Zakat-Ul-Maal and manages critical community services including funeral operations and cemetery development [1][2].

all_citations.claim: Bronze Seal of Transparency from Candid

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization holds a moderate overall score of 40/100, reflecting its significant community presence and religious alignment, though it is currently limited by low data confidence and a lack of verified financial efficiency metrics.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently has <cite id="3">limited public financial data</cite> available, resulting in a low data confidence score.
The current board consists of only <cite id="3">2 members</cite>, which is below the recommended size for an organization of this scale.

bbb_assessment.summary: No current BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment is available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's long history and receipt of federal grants for rental assistance suggest internal functional capacity despite reporting gaps.
risk_factors: <cite id="3">Incomplete financial breakdown in public records</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="3">lack of transparent financial data</cite> and a <cite id="3">board size of only 2 members</cite>, which presents governance risks.

confidence.notes: Low confidence due to lack of public financial transparency.

alignment.explanation: The organization has a high alignment for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> and serves the <cite id="3">fuqara and masakin</cite> categories. It fills a <cite id="3">niche religious-cultural cause area</cite> that is often underserved.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further improved by adding a <cite id="2">dedicated zakat transparency page</cite> that details exactly how zakat funds are segregated and distributed.

credibility.explanation: Donors can find trust in ISGH's <cite id="1">long-standing history since 1969</cite> and its <cite id="3">Bronze Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. However, credibility is currently limited by a <cite id="3">small board of 2 members</cite> and a lack of recent audited financials in public databases.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="3">expand its board size</cite> and publish full audited financial statements to move toward a Silver or Gold Candid seal.

impact.explanation: ISGH demonstrates high directness in its <cite id="1">capacity-building model</cite>, serving thousands through <cite id="1">weekend schools</cite> and <cite id="5">medical missions</cite>. However, the <cite id="3">program expense ratio is currently unverified</cite> due to missing tax filings.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="3">tracking cost-per-beneficiary</cite> and reporting consistent annual outcomes to enable financial health analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal outcome tracking in annual reports

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct assistance to individuals rather than organizations

rich_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Greater Houston serves as a central pillar for the Muslim community in Texas, providing essential religious, educational, and social welfare services.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support the long-term institutional stability of the Muslim community in Texas through religious and social infrastructure.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through a well-established local institution
Value the availability of essential services like Islamic funerals and cemeteries
Prioritize community-building and youth education in a Western context
Trust organizations with a multi-decade track record of service
giving_considerations: Donations support a wide range of services from medical missions to religious schools
Financial transparency is currently lower than national humanitarian peers
The organization operates as a large-scale community hub rather than a niche charity
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require high-transparency financial ratings (like a 4-star Charity Navigator rating) or those seeking international-only relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent internal tracking of outputs (beneficiaries, meals, students) without independent third-party impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: ISGH creates impact by providing the necessary infrastructure (mosques, schools, clinics) to help the community live sustainable lives.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the $5.4 million in assistance is reaching the most vulnerable community members effectively.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a primary service provider for a growing metropolitan Muslim population, the need for expanded cemetery and school capacity remains high.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="1">comprehensive funeral and cemetery services</cite> which are rare among smaller community centers.
similar_orgs: Muslim American Society of Greater LA
The Islamic Society of Southern California

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on religious and community services
similar_organizations.name: MCC East Bay
Muslim American Society of Greater LA
The Islamic Society of Southern California

strengths.detail: Operating since <cite id="1">1969</cite>, ISGH manages essential services including <cite id="1">Nikah services, funeral operations, and cemetery development</cite>.
The organization successfully distributed <cite id="1">$5.4 million in assistance</cite> and provided <cite id="5">82,696 food parcels</cite> to the community.
ISGH received the <cite id="3">ISNA Green Masjid Initiative Award</cite> for its commitment to sustainable operations.

strengths_deep_dive: ISGH's strength lies in its multi-faceted approach to community sustainability. Their educational impact is evidenced by <cite id="1">1,871 weekend school students</cite>, while their humanitarian reach is highlighted by <cite id="5">327 pediatric cardiac procedures</cite> and <cite id="6">2,791 pediatric cancer patient visits</cite>. This breadth of service, combined with a <cite id="3">57-year track record</cite>, makes them a foundational institution in the American Muslim landscape.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1969, the Islamic Society of Greater Houston (ISGH) has evolved into one of the largest and most comprehensive Islamic community organizations in the United States. The organization serves as a central pillar for the Muslim community in Texas, providing a wide array of services ranging from <cite id="1">religious infrastructure like funeral and cemetery management</cite> to social welfare and education. In 2023, the organization demonstrated significant community impact by distributing <cite id="1">$5.4 million in total assistance</cite> to those in need. Beyond financial aid, ISGH maintains a robust educational presence with <cite id="1">1,871 students enrolled in weekend schools</cite> and the distribution of <cite id="1">2,030 Qurans</cite>. The organization's reach extends into specialized humanitarian efforts, including <cite id="5">23 medical missions</cite> and the distribution of <cite id="5">82,696 food parcels</cite> as reported in their 2024 documentation. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, ISGH provides a verified channel for donors to fulfill their religious obligations, specifically serving the <cite id="3">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> categories of asnaf. While the organization holds a <cite id="3">Bronze Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, its current evaluation reflects a need for more detailed public financial reporting to match its substantial operational scale.
